result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Hoenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Restitiution of $1,932.51 for Roundy's to be paid joint and several with co-defendant and $293.28 of restitution to Roundy's to be paid soley by defendant. All restitution to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with Roundy's or co-defendant Nathan Ferra. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 32 days were granted. May be served in Milwaukee County but the court DOES NOT authorize electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

Attorney Samuel W. Benedict in court.   Defendant Michael P Hoenig did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict advises the Court the Defendant was remanded into custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections.  The Court reschedules the sentencing hearing and an order to produce is to be prepared from Milwaukee House of Corrections.  The Defendant to arrive at the Waukesha County Jail on 6/3/16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael P Hoenig in court, in custody by video, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Benedict to advise the Court if an order to be produce is to be prepared.  The Court quashes the previously stayed warrant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
